translated: An immeasurable thing is related to an immeasurable thing as mutuality condition: one of the aggregates is related to the other three aggregates as mutuality condition. … Two aggregates are related to the two other aggregates as mutuality condition. …

original: Paritto ca mahaggato ca dhammā mahaggatassa dhammassa aññamaññapaccayena paccayo—paṭisandhikkhaṇe
analyzed: parittaḥ ca mahaggataḥ ca dhammā mahaggatassa dhammassa aññamañña paccayena paccaya upaṭisandhi kkhaṇe
translated: A limited thing and a great thing are related to a great thing as mutuality condition: at the moment of rebirth-linking,

original: mahaggato eko khandho ca vatthu ca tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ aññamaññapaccayena paccayo …pe….
analyzed: mahaggataḥ ekaḥ khandho ca vatthu ca tiṇṇannam khandhānam aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ pe
translated: one of the great primaries and the physical heart-basis are related to the three other primaries as mutuality condition. …

original: Nissaya
analyzed: nissaya
translated: Support

original: Paritto dhammo parittassa dhammassa nissayapaccayena paccayo—paritto eko khandho
analyzed: parittaḥ dhammaḥ parittassa dhammassa nissaya paccayena paccaya uparittaḥ ekaḥ khandho
translated: A limited dhammas is related to a limited dhammas as a condition being a reliance condition, a limited one of the aggregates

original: tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ nissayapaccayena paccayo …pe… dve🔽khandhā …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe… khandhā vatthussa …pe… vatthu khandhānaṁ nissayapaccayena🔽paccayo …pe… ekaṁ mahābhūtaṁ …pe… asaññasattānaṁ ekaṁ mahābhūtaṁ …pe… cakkhāyatanaṁ
analyzed: tiṇṇannam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānaṃ ca rūpānaṃ nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ pe dve  khandhā pe paṭisandhikkhaṇe pe khandhā vatthussa pe vatthu khandhānam nissaya paccayena  paccayaḥ pe ekam mahābhūtam pe asaññasattānam ekam mahābhūtam pe cakkhu āyatana
translated: is related to three of the aggregates and to form that is derived from the four great elements as a condition being a reliance condition. … Two

original: cakkhuviññāṇassa …pe… kāyāyatanaṁ kāyaviññāṇassa … vatthu parittānaṁ khandhānaṁ nissayapaccayena paccayo.🔽Paritto dhammo mahaggatassa dhammassa nissayapaccayena paccayo—vatthu mahaggatānaṁ
analyzed: cakkhu viññāṇassa pe kāya āyatanam kāya viññāṇassa vatthu parittānam khandhānam nissaya paccayena paccayo  parittaḥ dhammaḥ mahaggatassa dhammassa nissaya paccayena paccayo vatthu
translated: of the aggregates … At the time of rebirth-linking … The aggregates are related to the physical basis as a condition being a reliance condition. … The physical basis is related to the aggregates as a condition being a reliance condition. … One of the great elements is related to the three other great elements as a condition being a reliance condition. … One of the great elements is related to the other three great elements and to the form that is derived from the great elements as a condition being a reliance condition. … In the case of the sense sphere, the eye base is related to eye-consciousness and to the states associated with it as a condition being a reliance condition. … The body base is related to body-consciousness and to the states associated with it as a condition being a reliance condition. … The physical basis is related to the limited aggregates as a condition being a reliance condition.🔽A limited dhammas is related to a great limited dhammas as a condition being a reliance condition, the physical basis is related to the great limited aggregates

original: khandhānaṁ nissayapaccayena paccayo. Paṭisandhikkhaṇe vatthu mahaggatānaṁ khandhānaṁ🔽nissayapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: khandhānaṃ nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe vatthu mahaggatānam khandhānam 🔽nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: as a condition being a reliance condition. At the time of rebirth-linking the physical basis is related to the great limited aggregates as a condition being a reliance condition.

original: Paritto dhammo appamāṇassa dhammassa nissayapaccayena paccayo—vatthu appamāṇānaṁ khandhānaṁ nissayapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: parittaḥ dhammaḥ appamāṇassa dhammassa nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ vatthu appamāṇānam khandhānam nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A limited phenomenon is related to a great phenomenon as a support condition, a great phenomenon is related to a great phenomenon as a support condition, a great phenomenon is related to a limited phenomenon as a support condition, a great phenomenon is related to a limited and a great phenomenon as a support condition.

original: Mahaggato dhammo mahaggatassa dhammassa nissayapaccayena paccayo—mahaggato eko khandho tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ …pe… dve khandhā …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….🔽Mahaggato dhammo parittassa dhammassa nissayapaccayena paccayo—mahaggatā khandhā
analyzed: mahaggataḥ dhammaḥ mahaggatassa dhammassa nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ mahaggataḥ ekaḥ khandhaḥ tiṇṇannam khandhānam pe dve khandhāḥ pe paṭisandhikkhaṇe pe  mahaggataḥ dhammaḥ parittassa dhammassa nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ mahaggatāḥ khandhāḥ
translated: A great phenomenon is related to a great phenomenon as a support condition: a great one of the aggregates is related to three aggregates as a support condition. Two aggregates are related to two aggregates as a support condition. At the moment of rebirth-linking …

original: cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ nissayapaccayena paccayo. Paṭisandhikkhaṇe mahaggatā khandhā🔽kaṭattārūpānaṁ nissayapaccayena paccayo.🔽Mahaggato dhammo parittassa ca mahaggatassa ca dhammassa nissayapaccayena paccayo—mahaggato
analyzed: citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi kkhaṇe mahaggatāḥ khandhāḥ  kaṭattā rūpānam nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ  mahaggataḥ dhammaḥ parittassa ca mahaggatassa ca dhammassa nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ mahaggataḥ
translated: A great phenomenon is related to a limited phenomenon as a support condition: the great aggregates are related to the kinds of materiality derived by clinging as a support condition. At the moment of rebirth-linking the great aggregates are related to the kinds of materiality originated by kamma as a support condition.

original: eko khandho tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ nissayapaccayena paccayo
analyzed: ekaḥ khandhaḥ tiṇṇannam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānañca rūpānam nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A great phenomenon is related to a limited and a great phenomenon as a support condition: a great one of the aggregates is related to three aggregates and to the kinds of materiality derived by clinging as a support condition.

original: …pe… dve khandhā …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….🔽Appamāṇo dhammo appamāṇassa dhammassa nissayapaccayena paccayo—appamāṇo eko khandho tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ nissayapaccayena paccayo …pe….🔽Appamāṇo dhammo parittassa dhammassa nissayapaccayena paccayo—appamāṇā khandhā cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ nissayapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: pe dve khandhā pe paṭisandhi kkhaṇe pe  appamāṇaḥ dhammaḥ appamāṇassa dhammassa nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ appamāṇaḥ ekaḥ khandho tiṇṇannam khandhānam nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ pe appamāṇaḥ dhammaḥ parittassa dhammassa nissaya paccayena paccayo appamāṇāḥ khandhāḥ citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam nissaya paccayena paccayo
translated: At the mind’s arising …🔽An immeasurable object is a condition, as support condition, for an immeasurable object: an immeasurable aggregate is a condition, as support condition, for three aggregates.🔽An immeasurable object is a condition, as support condition, for a limited object: the immeasurable aggregates are a condition, as support condition, for the kinds of materiality derived from the great primaries.

original: Appamāṇo dhammo parittassa ca appamāṇassa ca dhammassa nissayapaccayena paccayo—appamāṇo🔽eko khandho tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ nissayapaccayena paccayo …pe….
analyzed: appamāṇaḥ dhammaḥ parittassa ca appamāṇassa ca dhammassa nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ appamāṇaḥ  ekaḥ khandhaḥ tiṇṇannam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānañca rūpānam nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ pe
translated: An immeasurable object is a condition, as support condition, for a limited object and for an immeasurable object: an immeasurable aggregate is a condition, as support condition, for three aggregates and for the kinds of materiality derived from the great primaries.

original: Paritto ca appamāṇo ca dhammā parittassa dhammassa nissayapaccayena paccayo— appamāṇā khandhā ca mahābhūtā ca cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ nissayapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: parittaḥ ca appamāṇaḥ ca dhammā parittassa dhammassa nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ appamāṇāḥ khandhāḥ ca mahābhūtā ca citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A limited object and an immeasurable object are a condition, as support condition, for a limited object: the limited aggregates and the great primaries are a condition, as support condition, for the kinds of materiality derived from the great primaries.

original: Paritto ca appamāṇo ca dhammā appamāṇassa dhammassa nissayapaccayena paccayo— appamāṇo eko khandho ca vatthu ca tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ nissayapaccayena paccayo …pe… dve khandhā …pe….
analyzed: parittaḥ ca appamāṇaḥ ca dhammā appamāṇassa dhammassa nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ appamāṇaḥ ekaḥ khandho ca vatthu ca tiṇṇannam khandhānam nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ pe dve khandhā pe
translated: A measureless one of the aggregates and the physical basis are related to the three aggregates as a condition being a condition by way of support condition. … Two aggregates …

original: Paritto ca mahaggato ca dhammā parittassa dhammassa nissayapaccayena paccayo— mahaggatā
analyzed: parittaḥ ca mahaggataḥ ca dhammā parittassa dhammassa nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ mahaggatā
translated: A limited and a great state is related to a limited state as a condition being a condition by way of support condition.

original: khandhā ca mahābhūtā ca cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ nissayapaccayena paccayo. Paṭisandhikkhaṇe🔽mahaggatā khandhā ca mahābhūtā ca kaṭattārūpānaṁ nissayapaccayena paccayo.🔽Paritto ca mahaggato ca dhammā mahaggatassa dhammassa nissayapaccayena paccayo—mahaggato
analyzed: khandhā ca mahābhūtā ca citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi kkhaṇe  mahaggatā khandhā ca mahābhūtā ca kaṭattā rūpānam nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ  parittaḥ ca mahaggataḥ ca dhammā mahaggatassa dhammassa nissaya paccayena paccayo mahaggataḥ
translated: The great elements and the great primary elements are related to the form that is derived from the great elements and arisen with consciousness as a support condition. At the moment of rebirth-linking🔽the great elements and the great primary elements are related to the form that is the last of the kinds of bodily form and arisen with consciousness as a support condition.🔽A limited and a great state is related to a great state as a condition being a condition by way of support condition.

original: eko khandho ca vatthu ca tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ nissayapaccayena paccayo …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe
analyzed: ekaḥ khandho ca vatthu ca tiṇṇannam khandhānam nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ pe paṭisandhi khaṇe
translated: A great one of the aggregates and the physical basis are related to the three aggregates as a condition being a condition by way of support condition. … At the moment of rebirth-linking

original: mahaggato eko khandho ca vatthu ca tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ nissayapaccayena paccayo
analyzed: mahaggataḥ ekaḥ khandho ca vatthu ca tiṇṇannam khandhānam nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: One of the great aggregates is a condition, as support condition, for three aggregates.

original: …pe… dve khandhā …pe….
analyzed: pe dve khandhā pe
translated: … Two aggregates are a condition, as support condition, for two aggregates.

original: Upanissaya
analyzed: upanissaya
translated: Support

analyzed: parittaḥ dhammaḥ parittassa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa upanissayaḥ
translated: A limited object is a condition, as support condition, for a limited object—as object-predominance,

original: Appamāṇo dhammo mahaggatassa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo— anantarūpanissayo,🔽pakatūpanissayo …pe…. Pakatūpanissayo—appamāṇaṁ saddhaṁ upanissāya mahaggataṁ jhānaṁ
analyzed: appamāṇaḥ dhammaḥ mahaggatassa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ anantara upanissayaḥ 🔽pakata upanissayaḥ pe pakata upanissayaḥ appamāṇam saddham upanissāya mahaggatam jhāna
translated: An immeasurable Dhamma is a condition, as a support condition, for a great Dhamma—the support condition being prior and subsequent.🔽The support condition being only prior—immeasurable faith is a condition, as a support condition, for a great jhāna.

original: purejātapaccayena paccayo. Vatthupurejātaṁ—cakkhāyatanaṁ cakkhuviññāṇassa …pe… kāyāyatanaṁ
analyzed: purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ vatthu purejāta cakkhu āyatanam cakkhu viññāṇassa pe kāya āyatana
translated: The condition being by way of prenascence condition is: the prenascent physical basis, the eye base is for eye-consciousness … the body base is for body-consciousness …

original: kāyaviññāṇassa … vatthu parittānaṁ khandhānaṁ purejātapaccayena paccayo.🔽Paritto dhammo mahaggatassa dhammassa purejātapaccayena paccayo— ārammaṇapurejātaṁ,🔽vatthupurejātaṁ. Ārammaṇapurejātaṁ—dibbena cakkhunā rūpaṁ passati, dibbāya sotadhātuyā
analyzed: kāya viññāṇassa vatthu parittānam khandhānam purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ  parittaḥ dhammaḥ mahaggatassa dhammassa purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa purejāta  vatthu purejātaḥ ārammaṇa purejāta dibbena cakkhunā rūpam passati dibbāya sotadhātuyā
translated: A condition being prior and being a condition by way of prenascence condition. Prenascent condition means: the eye base is a condition for eye-consciousness … the body base is a condition for body-consciousness … the physical basis is a condition for the limited great primaries by way of prenascence condition.

original: saddaṁ suṇāti. Vatthupurejātaṁ—vatthu mahaggatānaṁ khandhānaṁ purejātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: saddam suṇāti vatthu purejāta vatthu mahaggatānam khandhānam purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A limited thing is a condition for a great thing by way of prenascence condition. Prenascent condition means: object prenascence condition and physical basis prenascence condition. Object prenascence condition means: by means of the divine eye one sees a visible form, by means of the divine ear element one hears a sound. Physical basis prenascence condition means: the physical basis is a condition for the great primaries by way of prenascence condition.

original: Paritto dhammo appamāṇassa dhammassa purejātapaccayena paccayo. Vatthupurejātaṁ—vatthu appamāṇānaṁ khandhānaṁ purejātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: parittaḥ dhammaḥ appamāṇassa dhammassa purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ vatthu purejāta vatthu appamāṇānam khandhānam purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A limited thing is a condition for an immeasurable thing by way of prenascence condition. Physical basis prenascence condition means: the physical basis is a condition for the immeasurable great primaries by way of prenascence condition.

original: Pacchājāta
analyzed: pacchājāta
translated: Postnascent

original: Paritto dhammo parittassa dhammassa pacchājātapaccayena paccayo—pacchājātā parittā khandhā purejātassa imassa kāyassa pacchājātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: parittaḥ dhammaḥ parittassa dhammassa pacchājāta paccayena paccayo pacchājātā parittāḥ khandhāḥ purejātassa imassa kāyassa pacchājāta paccayena paccayo
translated: A limited phenomenon is a condition, as subsequent condition, for a limited phenomenon. Subsequent limited aggregates are a condition, as subsequent condition, for this prior body.🔽A great phenomenon is a condition, as subsequent condition, for a limited phenomenon. Subsequent great aggregates are a condition, as subsequent condition, for this prior body.

original: Mahaggato dhammo parittassa dhammassa pacchājātapaccayena paccayo—pacchājātā mahaggatā khandhā purejātassa imassa kāyassa pacchājātapaccayena paccayo.🔽Appamāṇo dhammo parittassa dhammassa pacchājātapaccayena paccayo—pacchājātā appamāṇā khandhā purejātassa imassa kāyassa pacchājātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: mahaggataḥ dhammaḥ parittassa dhammassa pacchājāta paccayena paccaya upacchājātāḥ mahaggatāḥ khandhāḥ purejātassa imassa kāyassa pacchājāta paccayena paccayo  appamāṇaḥ dhammaḥ parittassa dhammassa pacchājāta paccayena paccaya upacchājātāḥ appamāṇāḥ khandhāḥ purejātassa imassa kāyassa pacchājāta paccayena paccayo
translated: An immeasurable phenomenon is a condition, as subsequent condition, for a limited phenomenon. Subsequent immeasurable aggregates are a condition, as subsequent condition, for this prior body.

original: Āsevana🔽Paritto dhammo parittassa dhammassa āsevanapaccayena paccayo—purimā purimā parittā🔽khandhā pacchimānaṁ pacchimānaṁ parittānaṁ khandhānaṁ …pe… anulomaṁ gotrabhussa,

original: Paritto dhammo mahaggatassa dhammassa āsevanapaccayena paccayo—paṭhamassa jhānassa🔽parikammaṁ tasseva āsevanapaccayena paccayo …pe… nevasaññānāsaññāyatanassa parikammaṁ
analyzed: parittaḥ dhammaḥ mahaggatassa dhammassa āsevana paccayena paccayaḥ upaṭhamassa jhānassa  parikammam tassa iva āsevana paccayena paccayaḥ pe nevasaññānāsaññāyatanassa parikamma
translated: A limited Dhamma is a condition, as repetition condition, for a great Dhamma: the preliminary work for the first jhāna is a condition, as repetition condition, for that jhāna … for the base consisting of neither perception nor non-perception …

original: tasseva āsevanapaccayena paccayo. Dibbassa cakkhussa parikammaṁ …pe… anāgataṁsañāṇassa🔽parikammaṁ anāgataṁsañāṇassa āsevanapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: tassa iva āsevana paccayena paccayaḥ dibbassa cakkhussa parikammam pe anāgata sañāṇassa  parikammam anāgata sañāṇassa āsevana paccayena paccayo
translated: A limited Dhamma is related to a great Dhamma as a condition by repetition: the preliminary work for the first jhāna is related to the first jhāna as a condition by repetition. … The preliminary work for the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception is related to the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception as a condition by repetition. The preliminary work for the divine eye is related to the divine eye as a condition by repetition. … The preliminary work for knowledge of the future is related to knowledge of the future as a condition by repetition.

original: Paritto dhammo appamāṇassa dhammassa āsevanapaccayena paccayo—gotrabhu maggassa … vodānaṁ maggassa āsevanapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: parittaḥ dhammaḥ appamāṇassa dhammassa āsevana paccayena paccayo gotrabhu maggassa vodānam maggassa āsevana paccayena paccayo
translated: A limited Dhamma is related to a measureless Dhamma as a condition by repetition: the path is related to the ending of defilements as a condition by repetition.

original: Mahaggato dhammo mahaggatassa dhammassa āsevanapaccayena paccayo—purimā purimā mahaggatā khandhā pacchimānaṁ pacchimānaṁ mahaggatānaṁ khandhānaṁ …pe… āsevanapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: mahaggataḥ dhammaḥ mahaggatassa dhammassa āsevana paccayena paccayo purimāḥ purimāḥ mahaggatāḥ khandhāḥ pacchimānam pacchimānam mahaggatānam khandhānam pe āsevana paccayena paccayo
translated: A great Dhamma is related to a great Dhamma as a condition by repetition: the earlier great aggregates are related to the later great aggregates as a condition by repetition. …

original: Kamma
analyzed: kamma
translated: Kamma

original: Paritto dhammo parittassa dhammassa kammapaccayena paccayo—sahajātā, nānākkhaṇikā.
analyzed: parittaḥ dhammaḥ parittassa dhammassa kamma paccayena paccayo sahajātā nānākkhaṇikā
translated: A limited phenomenon is a condition, as action condition, for a limited phenomenon. Conascent and postnascent.

original: Sahajātā—parittā cetanā sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ kammapaccayena🔽paccayo. Paṭisandhikkhaṇe parittā cetanā sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ kaṭattā ca rūpānaṁ🔽kammapaccayena paccayo. Nānākkhaṇikā—parittā cetanā vipākānaṁ parittānaṁ khandhānaṁ
analyzed: sahajātā aparittā cetanā sampayuttakānam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānaṃ ca rūpānam kamma paccayena  paccayaḥ paṭisandhi kkhaṇe parittā cetanā sampayuttakānam khandhānam kaṭattā ca rūpānam  kamma paccayena paccayaḥ nānākkhaṇikā aparittā cetanā vipākānam parittānam khandhānam
translated: Conascent: Limited volition is a condition, as action condition, for the states associated with it and for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.

original: kaṭattā ca rūpānaṁ kammapaccayena paccayo.🔽Mahaggato dhammo mahaggatassa dhammassa kammapaccayena paccayo—sahajātā, nānākkhaṇikā.🔽Sahajātā—mahaggatā cetanā sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ kammapaccayena paccayo. Paṭisandhikkhaṇe
analyzed: kaṭattā ca rūpānam kamma paccayena paccayaḥ  mahaggataḥ dhammaḥ mahaggatassa dhammassa kamma paccayena paccayo sahajātā nānākkhaṇikā  sahajātā a mahaggatā cetanā sampayuttakānam khandhānam kamma paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe
translated: At the moment of rebirth-linking, limited volition is a condition, as action condition, for the states associated with it and for the kinds of materiality due to kamma performed.🔽Postnascent: Limited volition is a condition, as action condition, for the kinds of materiality originated by the states that have had prior existence.🔽A great phenomenon is a condition, as action condition, for a great phenomenon. Conascent and postnascent.🔽Conascent: Great volition is a condition, as action condition, for the states associated with it. At the moment of rebirth-linking,

original: mahaggatā cetanā sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ kammapaccayena paccayo. Nānākkhaṇikā—mahaggatā
analyzed: mahaggatā cetanā sampayuttakānam khandhānam kamma paccayena paccayaḥ nānākkhaṇikā amahaggatā
translated: great volition is a condition, as action condition, for the states associated with it. Postnascent: Great volition is a condition, as action condition, for the kinds of materiality originated by the states that have had prior existence.

original: cetanā vipākānaṁ mahaggatānaṁ khandhānaṁ kammapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: cetanā vipākānam mahaggatānam khandhānam kamma paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: Intention is a condition, by way of kamma condition, for resultant great aggregates.

original: Mahaggato dhammo parittassa dhammassa kammapaccayena paccayo—sahajātā, nānākkhaṇikā.
analyzed: mahaggataḥ dhammaḥ parittassa dhammassa kamma paccayena paccayo sahajātā nānākkhaṇikā
translated: A great condition is a condition, by way of kamma condition, for a small condition: as conascent and as kammically acquired at different times.

original: Sahajātā—mahaggatā cetanā cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ kammapaccayena paccayo. Paṭisandhikkhaṇe🔽mahaggatā cetanā kaṭattārūpānaṁ kammapaccayena paccayo. Nānākkhaṇikā—mahaggatā cetanā
analyzed: sahajātā a mahaggatā cetanā citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam kamma paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi kkhaṇe  mahaggatā cetanā kaṭattā rūpānam kamma paccayena paccayaḥ nānākkhaṇikā amahaggatā cetanā
translated: As conascent: great intention is a condition, by way of kamma condition, for the form that is derived from the mind. At the moment of rebirth-linking

original: kaṭattārūpānaṁ kammapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: kaṭattā rūpānam kamma paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: great intention is a condition, by way of kamma condition, for the form that is the result of deeds done in previous lives. As kammically acquired at different times: great intention is a condition, by way of kamma condition, for the form that is the result of deeds done in previous lives.

original: Mahaggato dhammo parittassa ca mahaggatassa ca dhammassa kammapaccayena paccayo—sahajātā,🔽nānākkhaṇikā. Sahajātā—mahaggatā cetanā sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca
analyzed: mahaggataḥ dhammo parittassa ca mahaggatassa ca dhammassa kamma paccayena paccayo sahajātā  nānā khaṇikā sahajātā a mahaggatā cetanā sampayuttakānam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānam ca
translated: A great condition is a condition, by way of kamma condition, for a small condition and for a great condition: as conascent and as kammically acquired at different times.

original: rūpānaṁ kammapaccayena paccayo. Paṭisandhikkhaṇe mahaggatā cetanā sampayuttakānaṁ
analyzed: rūpānam kamma paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe mahaggatā cetanā sampayuttakānaṃ
translated: As conascent: great intention is a condition, by way of kamma condition, for the associated aggregates and for the form that is derived from the mind. At the moment of rebirth-linking great intention is a condition, by way of kamma condition, for the associated aggregates and for the form that is the result of deeds done in previous lives.

original: khandhānaṁ kaṭattā ca rūpānaṁ kammapaccayena paccayo. Nānākkhaṇikā—mahaggatā cetanā
analyzed: khandhānam kaṭattā ca rūpānam kamma paccayena paccayaḥ nānākkhaṇikā amahaggatā cetanā
translated: The great has the immeasurable as its kamma-result condition.🔽The immeasurable has the small as its kamma-result condition.🔽The great has the great as its kamma-result condition.

original: vipākānaṁ mahaggatānaṁ khandhānaṁ kaṭattā ca rūpānaṁ kammapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: vipākānam mahaggatānam khandhānam kaṭattā ca rūpānam kamma paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: The small has the small as its kamma-result condition.🔽The great has the small as its kamma-result condition.🔽The immeasurable has the immeasurable as its kamma-result condition.🔽The small has the great as its kamma-result condition.🔽The great has the great as its kamma-result condition.

original: Appamāṇo dhammo appamāṇassa dhammassa kammapaccayena paccayo—sahajātā, nānākkhaṇikā.
analyzed: appamāṇaḥ dhammaḥ appamāṇassa dhammassa kamma paccayena paccayo sahajātā nānākkhaṇikā
translated: The small has the small as its kamma-result condition.🔽The great has the small as its kamma-result condition.🔽The immeasurable has the immeasurable as its kamma-result condition.🔽The small has the great as its kamma-result condition.🔽The great has the great as its kamma-result condition.

original: Sahajātā—appamāṇā cetanā sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ kammapaccayena paccayo. Nānākkhaṇikā—appamāṇā
analyzed: sahajātā appamāṇā cetanā sampayuttakānam khandhānam kamma paccayena paccayaḥ nānākkhaṇikā appamāṇā
translated: The small has the small as its kamma-result condition.🔽The great has the small as its kamma-result condition.🔽The immeasurable has the immeasurable as its kamma-result condition.🔽The small has the great as its kamma-result condition.

original: cetanā vipākānaṁ appamāṇānaṁ khandhānaṁ kammapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: cetanā vipākānam appamāṇānam khandhānam kamma paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: The great has the great as its kamma-result condition.🔽The small has the small as its kamma-result condition.🔽The great has the small as its kamma-result condition.🔽The immeasurable has the immeasurable as its kamma-result condition.🔽The small has the great as its kamma-result condition.🔽The great has the great as its kamma-result condition.

original: Appamāṇo dhammo parittassa dhammassa kammapaccayena paccayo—appamāṇā cetanā cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ kammapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: appamāṇaḥ dhammaḥ parittassa dhammassa kamma paccayena paccayo appamāṇā cetanā citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam kamma paccayena paccayo
translated: The small has the small as its kamma-result condition.🔽The great has the small as its kamma-result condition.🔽The immeasurable has the immeasurable as its kamma-result condition.🔽The small has the great as its kamma-result condition.

original: Appamāṇo dhammo parittassa ca appamāṇassa ca dhammassa kammapaccayena paccayo— appamāṇā cetanā sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ kammapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: appamāṇaḥ dhammaḥ parittassa ca appamāṇassa ca dhammassa kamma paccayena paccayaḥ appamāṇā cetanā sampayuttakānam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānaṃ ca rūpānam kamma paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A great object is a condition, as kamma condition, for a limited object and for a great object. Great volition is a condition, as kamma condition, for the associated aggregates and for the kinds of materiality derived by way of kamma from the great primaries.

original: Vipāka🔽Paritto dhammo parittassa dhammassa vipākapaccayena paccayo—vipāko paritto eko khandho🔽tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ vipākapaccayena paccayo …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe🔽…pe… khandhā vatthussa vipākapaccayena paccayo.🔽Mahaggato dhammo mahaggatassa dhammassa vipākapaccayena paccayo …pe…. (Tisso pañhā, pavattipaṭisandhi kātabbā.)
analyzed: vipāka  parittaḥ dhammaḥ parittassa dhammassa vipāka paccayena paccayaḥ vipākaḥ parittaḥ ekaḥ khandho  tiṇṇannam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānaṃ ca rūpānaṃ vipāka paccayena paccayaḥ pe paṭisandhi khaṇe  pe khandhāḥ vatthussa vipāka paccayena paccayo  mahaggataḥ dhammaḥ mahaggatassa dhammassa vipāka paccayena paccayaḥ pe tisso pañhā pavatti paṭisandhi kātabbā
translated: Resultant

original: Appamāṇo dhammo appamāṇassa dhammassa vipākapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi. (Pavattimeva.)🔽Āhārādi
analyzed: appamāṇaḥ dhammaḥ appamāṇassa dhammassa vipāka paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi pavattim eva  āhāra ādi
translated: A limited object is a condition, as result condition, for a limited object. The result of one of the aggregates is a condition, as result condition, for the three aggregates and for the kinds of materiality derived by way of nutriment from the four great primaries. … At the moment of rebirth-linking … the three aggregates are a condition, as result condition, for the kinds of materiality derived by way of nutriment from the four great primaries. The three aggregates are a condition, as result condition, for the four great primaries. The three aggregates are a condition, as result condition, for the three aggregates and for the kinds of materiality derived by way of nutriment from the four great primaries. The four great primaries are a condition, as result condition, for the three aggregates and for the kinds of materiality derived by way of nutriment from the four great primaries. The four great primaries are a condition, as result condition, for the three aggregates and for the kinds of materiality derived by way of temperature from the four great primaries. The four great primaries are a condition, as result condition, for the three aggregates and for the kinds of materiality derived by way of consciousness from the four great primaries. The four great primaries are a condition, as result condition, for the three aggregates and for the kinds of materiality derived by way of kamma from the four great primaries. The four great primaries are a condition, as result condition, for the three aggregates and for the kinds of materiality derived by way of nutriment and by way of consciousness from the four great primaries. The four great primaries are a condition, as result condition, for the three aggregates and for the kinds of materiality derived by way of kamma and by way of consciousness from the four great primaries. The four great primaries are a condition, as result condition, for the three aggregates and for the kinds of materiality derived by way of nutriment and by way of kamma and by way of consciousness from the four great primaries. A great object is a condition, as result condition, for a great object. … (Three questions and answers as above.)

original: Paritto dhammo parittassa dhammassa āhārapaccayena paccayo …pe… indriyapaccayena
analyzed: parittaḥ dhammaḥ parittassa dhammassa āhāra paccayena paccayaḥ pe indriya paccayena
translated: A great object is a condition, as result condition, for a limited object. … (Three questions

original: paccayo … jhānapaccayena paccayo … maggapaccayena paccayo … sampayuttapaccayena paccayo🔽… vippayuttapaccayena paccayo—sahajātaṁ, purejātaṁ, pacchājātaṁ. Sahajātā—parittā🔽khandhā cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ vippayuttapaccayena paccayo. Paṭisandhikkhaṇe
analyzed: paccayaḥ jhāna paccayena paccayaḥ magga paccayena paccayaḥ sampayutta paccayena paccayaḥ  vippayutta paccayena paccayo sahajāta purejāta pacchājāta sahajāta aparittā  khandhāḥ citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi kkhaṇe
translated: Condition by way of object condition … Condition by way of absorption condition … Condition by way of path condition … Condition by way of association condition …🔽… Condition by way of dissociation condition: conascence, prenascence, postnascence. Conascence: the small Faculties are related to the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness as condition by way of dissociation condition. At the time of rebirth-linking

original: parittā khandhā kaṭattārūpānaṁ vippayuttapaccayena paccayo. Khandhā vatthussa …pe…🔽vatthu khandhānaṁ vippayuttapaccayena paccayo. Purejātaṁ—cakkhāyatanaṁ cakkhuviññāṇassa
analyzed: parittāḥ khandhāḥ kaṭattā rūpānam vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ khandhāḥ vatthussa pe  vatthu khandhānam vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ purejāta cakkhu āyatanam cakkhu viññāṇassa
translated: the small Faculties are related to the kinds of materiality due to kamma-formation as condition by way of dissociation condition. The Faculties are related to the physical basis as condition by way of dissociation condition. …

original: vippayuttapaccayena paccayo …pe… kāyāyatanaṁ kāyaviññāṇassa vippayuttapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ pe kāya āyatanam kāya viññāṇassa vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: The physical basis is related to the Faculties as condition by way of dissociation condition. Prenascence: the eye faculty is related to eye-consciousness as condition by way of dissociation condition. … The body faculty is related to body-consciousness as condition by way of dissociation condition.

original: Vatthu parittānaṁ khandhānaṁ vippayuttapaccayena paccayo. Pacchājātā—parittā khandhā🔽purejātassa imassa kāyassa vippayuttapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: vatthu parittānam khandhānam vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ pacchājāta aparittāḥ khandhāḥ 🔽purejātassa imassa kāyassa vippayutta paccayena paccayo
translated: The physical basis is related to the small Faculties as condition by way of dissociation condition. Postnascence: the small Faculties are related to this prenascent body as condition by way of dissociation condition.

original: Paritto dhammo mahaggatassa dhammassa vippayuttapaccayena paccayo—sahajātaṁ, purejātaṁ.
analyzed: parittaḥ dhammaḥ mahaggatassa dhammassa vippayutta paccayena paccayo sahajāta purejāta
translated: A limited phenomenon is related to a great phenomenon as a condition by way of dissociation condition: as conascence, as prenascence.

original: Sahajātaṁ—paṭisandhikkhaṇe vatthu mahaggatānaṁ khandhānaṁ vippayuttapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: sahajāta paṭisandhi khaṇe vatthu mahaggatānam khandhānam vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: As conascence: at the time of rebirth-linking, the great material phenomena are related to the great phenomena as a condition by way of dissociation condition.

original: Purejātaṁ—vatthu mahaggatānaṁ khandhānaṁ vippayuttapaccayena paccayo.🔽Paritto dhammo appamāṇassa dhammassa vippayuttapaccayena paccayo. Purejātaṁ—vatthu appamāṇānaṁ khandhānaṁ vippayuttapaccayena paccayo.🔽Mahaggato dhammo parittassa dhammassa vippayuttapaccayena paccayo—sahajātaṁ, pacchājātaṁ.
analyzed: purejāta vatthu mahaggatānam khandhānam vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ  parittaḥ dhammaḥ appamāṇassa dhammassa vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ purejāta vatthu appamāṇānam khandhānam vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ  mahaggataḥ dhammaḥ parittassa dhammassa vippayutta paccayena paccayo sahajāta pacchājāta
translated: As prenascence: the great material phenomena are related to the great phenomena as a condition by way of dissociation condition.🔽A limited phenomenon is related to a measureless phenomenon as a condition by way of dissociation condition: as prenascence: the great material phenomena are related to the measureless phenomena as a condition by way of dissociation condition.🔽A great phenomenon is related to a limited phenomenon as a condition by way of dissociation condition: as conascence, as postnascence.

original: Sahajātā—mahaggatā khandhā cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ vippayuttapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: sahajātā a mahaggatāḥ khandhāḥ citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: As conascence: the great phenomena are related to the material phenomena derived by clinging as a condition by way of dissociation condition.

original: Paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe… pacchājātā—mahaggatā khandhā purejātassa imassa kāyassa vippayuttapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: paṭisandhi kkhaṇe pe pacchājātā mahaggatā khandhā purejātassa imassa kāyassa vippayutta paccayena paccayo
translated: At the time of rebirth-linking … As postnascence: the great phenomena are related to this body as a condition by way of dissociation condition.

original: Appamāṇo dhammo parittassa dhammassa vippayuttapaccayena paccayo—sahajātaṁ, pacchājātaṁ.🔽Sahajātā—appamāṇā khandhā cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ vippayuttapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: appamāṇaḥ dhammaḥ parittassa dhammassa vippayutta paccayena paccayo sahajāta pacchājāta  sahajātā appamāṇāḥ khandhāḥ citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: Conascence: the great elements are a condition, by way of disassociation condition, for the form that is derived from the great elements.

original: Pacchājātā—appamāṇā khandhā purejātassa imassa kāyassa vippayuttapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: pacchājātā appamāṇā khandhā purejātassa imassa kāyassa vippayutta paccayena paccayo
translated: Post-nascence: the great elements are a condition, by way of disassociation condition, for this pre-nascent body.

original: Atthi
analyzed: atthi
translated: There is

original: Paritto dhammo parittassa dhammassa atthipaccayena paccayo—sahajātaṁ, purejātaṁ,🔽pacchājātaṁ, āhāraṁ, indriyaṁ. Sahajāto—paritto eko khandho tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ
analyzed: parittaḥ dhammaḥ parittassa dhammassa atthi paccayena paccayo sahajāta purejāta  pacchājātaḥ āhāraḥ indriya ekaḥ khandho tiṇṇannam khandhānaṃ
translated: A limited object is a condition, by way of presence condition, for a limited object—conascence, prenascence,🔽post-nascence, nutriment, faculty. Conascence: a limited one of the aggregates is a condition, by way of presence condition, for three of the aggregates

original: cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ atthipaccayena paccayo …pe… dve khandhā …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe
analyzed: citta samuṭṭhānānaṃ ca rūpānaṃ atthi paccayena paccayaḥ pe dve khandhā pe paṭisandhi kkhaṇe
translated: and for the form that is derived from the great elements. … Two of the aggregates are … At the time of rebirth-linking …

original: …pe… khandhā vatthussa atthipaccayena paccayo. Vatthu khandhānaṁ atthipaccayena paccayo;
analyzed: pe khandhāḥ vatthussa atthi paccayena paccayaḥ vatthu khandhānaṃ atthi paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: … the aggregates are a condition, by way of presence condition, for the physical basis. The physical basis is a condition, by way of presence condition, for the aggregates.

original: ekaṁ mahābhūtaṁ …pe… asaññasattānaṁ …pe…. Purejātaṁ—cakkhuṁ …pe… vatthuṁ aniccato
analyzed: ekam mahābhūtam pe asaññasattānam pe purejāta cakkhum pe vatthum aniccato
translated: One of the great elements is … for the beings without mind … Pre-nascence: the eye is a condition, by way of presence condition, for the forms … for the visual consciousness … for the states associated with and conascent with visual consciousness. The ear is a condition, by way of presence condition, for the sounds … for the auditory consciousness … for the states associated with and conascent with auditory consciousness. The nose is a condition, by way of presence condition, for the smells … for the olfactory consciousness … for the states associated with and conascent with olfactory consciousness. The tongue is a condition, by way of presence condition, for the tastes … for the gustatory consciousness … for the states associated with and conascent with gustatory consciousness. The body is a condition, by way of presence condition, for the tangible data … for the bodily consciousness … for the states associated with and conascent with bodily consciousness. The mind is a condition, by way of presence condition, for the mental phenomena … for the mind-consciousness … for the states associated with and conascent with mind-consciousness. The physical basis is a condition, by way of presence condition, for the life faculty and for the states associated with and conascent with the life faculty. The physical basis is a condition, by way of presence condition, for the faculties of femininity and masculinity and for the states associated with and conascent with the faculties of femininity

original: …pe… vipassati assādeti abhinandati, taṁ ārabbha rāgo uppajjati …pe… domanassaṁ uppajjati,🔽rūpāyatanaṁ cakkhuviññāṇassa …pe… phoṭṭhabbāyatanaṁ kāyaviññāṇassa atthipaccayena
analyzed: pe vipassati assādeti abhinandati tam ārabbha rāgaḥ uppajjati pe domanassam uppajjati  rūpa āyatanam cakkhu viññāṇassa pe phoṭṭhabba āyatanam kāya viññāṇassa atthi paccayena
translated: … he perceives, he is attached, he delights, he desires, and because of that desire, greed arises … and because of that desire, distress arises.🔽The visible-form element is a condition, as presence condition, for eye-consciousness … The tangible-object element is a condition, as presence condition, for body-consciousness.

original: paccayo. Cakkhāyatanaṁ cakkhuviññāṇassa atthipaccayena paccayo …pe… kāyāyatanaṁ kāyaviññāṇassa
analyzed: paccayaḥ cakkhu āyatanam cakkhu viññāṇassa atthi paccayena paccayaḥ pe kāya āyatanam kāya viññāṇassa
translated: The eye base is a condition, as presence condition, for eye-consciousness … The body base is a condition, as presence condition, for body-consciousness.

original: …pe… vatthu parittānaṁ khandhānaṁ atthipaccayena paccayo. Pacchājātā—parittā khandhā
analyzed: vatthu parittānam khandhānam atthi paccayena paccayaḥ pacchājāta aparittā khandhā
translated: … The physical basis is a condition, as presence condition, for the minor mental factors. Postnascence—the minor aggregates

original: purejātassa imassa kāyassa atthipaccayena paccayo. Kabaḷīkāro āhāro—imassa kāyassa
analyzed: purejātassa imassa kāyassa atthi paccayena paccayo kabaḷīkāraḥ āhāraḥ imassa kāyassa
translated: are a condition, as presence condition, for this prenascent body. Nutriment as physical food is a condition, as presence condition, for this body.

original: atthipaccayena paccayo. Rūpajīvitindriyaṁ—kaṭattārūpānaṁ atthipaccayena paccayo.🔽Paritto dhammo mahaggatassa dhammassa atthipaccayena paccayo—sahajātaṁ, purejātaṁ.
analyzed: atthi paccayena paccayaḥ rūpa jīvita indriya kaṭattā rūpānaṃ atthi paccayena paccayaḥ  parittaḥ dhammaḥ mahaggatassa dhammassa atthi paccayena paccayo sahajāta purejāta
translated: The material life faculty is a condition, as presence condition, for the derived materiality.🔽A minor phenomenon is a condition, as presence condition, for a major phenomenon—as conascence, as prenascence.

original: Sahajātaṁ—paṭisandhikkhaṇe vatthu mahaggatānaṁ khandhānaṁ atthipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: sahajāta paṭisandhi khaṇe vatthu mahaggatānam khandhānam atthi paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: As conascence—at the moment of rebirth-linking, the physical basis is a condition, as presence condition, for the major aggregates.

original: Purejātaṁ—dibbena cakkhunā rūpaṁ passati, dibbāya sotadhātuyā saddaṁ suṇāti, vatthu
analyzed: purejāta dibbena cakkhunā rūpam passati dibbāya sotadhātuyā saddam suṇāti vatthu
translated: Having arisen before: One sees a visible object with the divine eye, hears a sound with the divine ear element, and has a mind-object as object with the mind. The mind-object is a condition, as a condition consisting in a cognitive object, for the mind element and for the mind-consciousness element.

original: mahaggatānaṁ khandhānaṁ atthipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: mahaggatānam khandhānam atthi paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A condition, by way of presence condition, for the great primaries that are a condition for the great primaries.

original: Paritto dhammo appamāṇassa dhammassa atthipaccayena paccayo. Purejātaṁ—vatthu appamāṇānaṁ khandhānaṁ atthipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: parittaḥ dhammaḥ appamāṇassa dhammassa atthi paccayena paccayaḥ purejāta vatthu appamāṇānam khandhānam atthi paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A limited object is a condition, by way of presence condition, for an unlimited object. A condition, by way of presence condition, for the unlimited objects that are a condition for the great primaries.🔽A great object is a condition, by way of presence condition, for a great object. A great primary is a condition, by way of presence condition, for the three other great primaries. Two great primaries are a condition, by way of presence condition, for the two other great primaries. At the time of rebirth-linking, the great primaries are a condition, by way of presence condition, for the three other great primaries.

original: Mahaggato dhammo mahaggatassa dhammassa atthipaccayena paccayo. Mahaggato eko khandho tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ …pe… dve khandhā …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….🔽Mahaggato dhammo parittassa dhammassa atthipaccayena paccayo—sahajātaṁ, pacchājātaṁ.🔽Sahajātā—mahaggatā khandhā cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ atthipaccayena paccayo. Paṭisandhikkhaṇe
analyzed: mahaggataḥ dhammaḥ mahaggatassa dhammassa atthi paccayena paccayaḥ mahaggataḥ ekaḥ khandhaḥ tiṇṇannam khandhānam pe dve khandhāḥ pe paṭisandhikkhaṇe pe  mahaggataḥ dhammaḥ parittassa dhammassa atthi paccayena paccayo sahajāta pacchājāta  sahajātā a mahaggatā khandhā citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānaṃ atthi paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi kkhaṇe
translated: A great object is a condition, by way of presence condition, for a limited object. A condition, by way of presence condition, for the great primaries that are a condition for the limited objects that are the four great primaries.

analyzed: purejātassa imassa kāyassa atthi paccayena paccayo
translated: The great is a condition, as presence condition, for this body that arose before it.

original: Mahaggato dhammo parittassa ca mahaggatassa ca dhammassa atthipaccayena paccayo—mahaggato
analyzed: mahaggataḥ dhammaḥ parittassa ca mahaggatassa ca dhammassa atthi paccayena paccayaḥ mahaggataḥ

analyzed: khandhā purejātassa imassa kāyassa atthi paccayena paccayo
translated: As conascence: the measureless aggregates are a condition, as presence condition, for the kinds of materiality derived by nutriment. As postnascence: the measureless aggregates are a condition, as presence condition, for this body that arose before them.

original: Appamāṇo dhammo parittassa ca appamāṇassa ca dhammassa atthipaccayena paccayo— appamāṇo eko khandho tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ atthipaccayena paccayo …pe….
analyzed: appamāṇaḥ dhammaḥ parittassa ca appamāṇassa ca dhammassa atthi paccayena paccayaḥ appamāṇaḥ ekaḥ khandho tiṇṇannam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānaṃ ca rūpānaṃ atthi paccayena paccayaḥ pe
translated: A great object is related to three aggregates and to the form that is derived from the four great elements as a substantial cause.

original: Paritto ca appamāṇo ca dhammā parittassa dhammassa atthipaccayena paccayo— sahajātaṁ,
analyzed: parittaḥ ca appamāṇaḥ ca dhammā parittassa dhammassa atthi paccayena paccayo sahajāta
translated: A limited object and a great object are related to a limited object as a substantial cause. They are related as conascence,🔽postnascence, nutriment, and faculty.

original: pacchājātaṁ, āhāraṁ, indriyaṁ. Sahajātā—appamāṇā khandhā ca mahābhūtā ca cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ🔽rūpānaṁ atthipaccayena paccayo. Pacchājātā—appamāṇā khandhā ca kabaḷīkāro āhāro ca
analyzed: pacchājāta āhāra indriya sahajātā appamāṇā khandhā ca mahābhūtā ca citta samuṭṭhānāna  rūpānaṃ atthi paccayena paccayo pacchājātā appamāṇā khandhā ca kabaḷīkāro āhāro ca
translated: As conascence, the great objects and the four great elements are related to the form that is derived from the four great elements as a substantial cause.🔽As postnascence, the great objects and physical nutriment are related to this body as a substantial cause.

original: imassa kāyassa atthipaccayena paccayo. Pacchājātā—appamāṇā khandhā ca rūpajīvitindriyañca🔽kaṭattārūpānaṁ atthipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: imassa kāyassa atthi paccayena paccayaḥ pacchājātā appamāṇā khandhā ca rūpa jīvitindriyañca  kaṭattā rūpānam atthi paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: As postnascence, the great objects and the material life faculty are related to the form that is the outcome of kamma as a substantial cause.

original: Paritto ca appamāṇo ca dhammā appamāṇassa dhammassa atthipaccayena paccayo— sahajātaṁ,
analyzed: parittaḥ ca appamāṇaḥ ca dhammā appamāṇassa dhammassa atthi paccayena paccayo sahajāta
translated: A limited object and a great object are related to a great object as a substantial cause. They are related as conascence,

translated: The condition being by way of presence condition is:🔽The great primaries and the physical heart-basis are to the three mental aggregates.

original: paccayo …pe… dve khandhā …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe mahaggato eko khandho ca vatthu ca
analyzed: paccayaḥ pe dve khandhā pe paṭisandhi kkhaṇe mahaggataḥ ekaḥ khandho ca vatthu ca
translated: At the time of rebirth-linking the great primaries and the physical heart-basis are to the three mental aggregates.🔽The condition being by way of presence condition is:🔽The two aggregates and the physical heart-basis are to the three mental aggregates.

analyzed: tiṇṇannam khandhānaṃ atthi paccayena paccayaḥ pe dve khandhā ca vatthu ca pe natthi paccayena

original: Saṅkhyāvāra

original: Suddha

translated: The Pure

original: Hetuyā satta, ārammaṇe satta, adhipatiyā satta, anantare nava, samanantare nava,
analyzed: hetuyā satta ārammaṇe satta adhipatiyā satta anantare nava samanantare nava
translated: As root cause there are seven, as object there are seven, as predominance there are seven, as proximity there are nine, as contiguity there are nine,

original: sahajāte ekādasa, aññamaññe satta, nissaye terasa, upanissaye nava, purejāte tīṇi,
analyzed: sahajāte ekādasa aññamaññe satta nissaye terasa upanissaye nava purejāte tīṇi
translated: as arising together there are eleven, as support there are seven, as dependence there are thirteen, as decisive support there are nine, as prenascence there are three,

original: pacchājāte tīṇi, āsevane cattāri, kamme satta, vipāke āhāre indriye jhāne magge satta,
analyzed: pacchājāte tīṇi āsevane cattāri kamme satta vipāke āhāre indriye jhāne magge satta
translated: as postnascence there are three, as repetition there are four, as kamma there are seven, as result there are seven, as nutriment there are seven, as faculty there are seven, as path there are seven,

analyzed: sampayutte tīṇi vippayutte pañca atthiyā terasa natthiyā nava vigate nava avigate

analyzed: terasaḥ evam
translated: (This is to be expanded in the same way.)

original: Anulomaṁ.
analyzed: anuloma
translated: In the forward order.

original: Paccanīyuddhāra
analyzed: paccanīya uddhāra
translated: Reverse order

original: Paritto dhammo parittassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena🔽paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo … purejātapaccayena paccayo … pacchājātapaccayena🔽paccayo … kammapaccayena paccayo … āhārapaccayena paccayo … indriyapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: parittaḥ dhammaḥ parittassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta paccayena  paccayo upanissaya paccayena paccayo purejāta paccayena paccayo pacchājāta paccayena  paccayaḥ kamma paccayena paccayaḥ āhāra paccayena paccayaḥ indriya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A limited object is a condition, as object condition, for a limited consciousness element and for the two limited kinds of contact and for the three kinds of feeling, perception and volition associated with that consciousness. It is a condition, as conascence condition, … as support condition, …🔽as prenascence condition, … as postnascence condition, … as kamma condition, … as nutriment condition, … as faculty condition.

original: Paritto dhammo mahaggatassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo … purejātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: parittaḥ dhammaḥ mahaggatassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A limited object is a condition, as object condition, for a great object consciousness element and for the two great kinds of contact and for the three kinds of feeling, perception and volition associated with that consciousness. It is a condition, as conascence condition, … as support condition, … as prenascence condition.

original: Paritto dhammo appamāṇassa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo … purejātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: parittaḥ dhammaḥ appamāṇassa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A limited object is a condition, as support condition, … as prenascence condition, for an immeasurable object consciousness element.

original: Mahaggato dhammo mahaggatassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: mahaggataḥ dhammaḥ mahaggatassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A great object is a condition, as object condition, for a great object consciousness element and for the two great kinds of contact and for the three kinds of feeling, perception and volition associated with that consciousness. It is a condition, as conascence condition, … as support condition, …

original: Mahaggato dhammo parittassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo … pacchājātapaccayena paccayo … kammapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: mahaggataḥ dhammaḥ parittassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ pacchājāta paccayena paccayaḥ kamma paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A great thing is a condition, as object condition, for a small thing … as co-nascence condition … as support condition … as post-nascence condition … as kamma condition.

original: Mahaggato dhammo appamāṇassa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: mahaggataḥ dhammaḥ appamāṇassa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A great thing is a condition, as support condition, for a measureless thing.

original: Mahaggato dhammo parittassa ca mahaggatassa ca dhammassa sahajātapaccayena paccayo … kammapaccayena paccayo.🔽Appamāṇo dhammo appamāṇassa dhammassa (…) sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: mahaggataḥ dhammaḥ parittassa ca mahaggatassa ca dhammassa sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ kamma paccayena paccayaḥ  appamāṇaḥ dhammaḥ appamāṇassa dhammassa sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A great thing is a condition, as co-nascence condition, as mutuality condition, as support condition, as kamma condition, for a small thing and for a great thing.🔽A measureless thing is a condition, as co-nascence condition, as mutuality condition, as support condition, for a measureless thing.

original: Appamāṇo dhammo parittassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo … pacchājātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: appamāṇaḥ dhammaḥ parittassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ pacchājāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A measureless thing is a condition, as object condition, as co-nascence condition, as mutuality condition, as support condition, as pre-nascence condition, as post-nascence condition, for a small thing.

original: Appamāṇo dhammo mahaggatassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo.🔽Appamāṇo dhammo parittassa ca appamāṇassa ca dhammassa sahajātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: appamāṇaḥ dhammaḥ mahaggatassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ  appamāṇaḥ dhammaḥ parittassa ca appamāṇassa ca dhammassa sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: An immeasurable object is related to a great object as object condition and as support condition.🔽An immeasurable object is related to a limited object and to an immeasurable object as conascence condition.

original: Paritto ca appamāṇo ca dhammā parittassa dhammassa sahajātaṁ, pacchājātaṁ, āhāraṁ, indriyaṁ.
analyzed: paritto ca appamāṇo ca dhammā parittassa dhammassa sahajāta pacchājāta āhāra indriya
translated: A limited object and an immeasurable object are related to a limited object as conascence, post-nascence, nutriment, and faculty conditions.

original: Paritto ca appamāṇo ca dhammā appamāṇassa dhammassa sahajātaṁ, purejātaṁ.🔽Paritto ca mahaggato ca dhammā parittassa dhammassa sahajātaṁ, pacchājātaṁ, āhāraṁ, indriyaṁ.
analyzed: parittaḥ ca appamāṇaḥ ca dhammā appamāṇassa dhammassa sahajāta purejāta  paritto ca mahaggato ca dhammā parittassa dhammassa sahajāta pacchājāta āhāra indriya
translated: A limited object and an immeasurable object are related to an immeasurable object as conascence and pre-nascence conditions.🔽A limited object and a great object are related to a limited object as conascence, post-nascence, nutriment, and faculty conditions.

original: Paritto ca mahaggato ca dhammā mahaggatassa dhammassa sahajātaṁ, purejātaṁ.🔽1.13.7.2. Paccayapaccanīya
analyzed: parittaḥ ca mahaggataḥ ca dhammā mahaggatassa dhammassa sahajāta purejāta  paccaya paccanīya

translated: eleven in terms of presence, seven in terms of mutuality, thirteen in terms of support, nine in terms of dependence, three in terms of prenascence,

original: pacchājāte tīṇi, āsevane cattāri, kamme satta …pe… magge satta, sampayutte tīṇi,🔽vippayutte pañca, atthiyā terasa, natthiyā nava, vigate nava, avigate terasa.
analyzed: pacchājāte tīṇi āsevane cattāri kamme satta pe magge satta sampayutte tīṇi  vippayutte pañca atthiyā terasa natthiyā nava vigate nava avigate terasa
translated: three in terms of postnascence, four in terms of nutriment, seven in terms of faculty, … seven in terms of path, three in terms of association,

original: Paccanīyānulomaṁ.
analyzed: paccanīya anuloma
translated: five in terms of dissociation, thirteen in terms of presence, nine in terms of absence, nine in terms of disappearance, thirteen in terms of non-disappearance.🔽The section in reverse order.

original: Parittattikaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: paritta ttikam
translated: The short section is finished.
